title: This website lets you blind-test GPT-5 vs. GPT-4o—and the results may surprise you
optimized_headline: Blind-test GPT-5 against GPT-4o: Discover the unexpected results!
raw_excerpt: Take this blind test to discover whether you truly prefer OpenAI's GPT-5 or the older GPT-4o—without knowing which model you're using.
raw_body: Take this blind test to discover whether you truly prefer OpenAI's GPT-5 or the older GPT-4o—without knowing which model you're using.
speedrun: A new website allows users to blind-test OpenAI's GPT-5 against the older GPT-4o, helping people discover their true preferences without bias. This test aims to reveal which model performs better in real-world tasks. It matters now as users can make informed choices about which AI to rely on for their needs.
why_it_matters: Users looking for AI assistance can better understand which model suits their tasks, leading to improved outcomes in their projects.
This initiative could influence how companies choose AI models, impacting market competition and development priorities.

lenses.eli12: Imagine tasting two types of chocolate without knowing which is which. This new website lets you do just that with AI models, helping you find your favorite without bias. It’s a fun way for people to see which AI really works better for them in everyday tasks.
lenses.pm: For product managers, this blind test highlights the importance of user preference in AI models. Understanding which model resonates more with users can guide product development and marketing strategies. A practical next step is to analyze user feedback from the test to enhance offerings.
lenses.engineer: This website uses a simple approach to compare GPT-5 and GPT-4o by masking which model is being tested. It provides valuable insights into performance differences, but may not capture all aspects of user experience. Engineers should consider how these results align with user needs and model capabilities.
